info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 9:24PM CST until February 23 at 5:33AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Agricultural levee begins to be slightly overtopped. No residences are affected at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 23.5 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 11.4 Wed 9 pm 20.8 23.5 23.0 21.7 17.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The NationalWeather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
